seng202.team1.Model.CsvHandling

Class CSVLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng202.team1.Model.CsvHandling.CSVLoader

  • public class CSVLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that can load CSV files and return ArrayLists of different subclasses of DataPoint.

    • Method Detail

      • loadCSV

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.csv.CSVRecord> loadCSV(java.lang.String filename)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Takes a file named filename, which should be a csv, and returns an ArrayList of type CSVRecord. This can be queried using the get(index) method. This file should not be provided by the app (i.e. it should be provided by the user at runtime).
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of the file to get data from.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of CSVRecords of the each row of the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.

      • loadCSV

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.csv.CSVRecord> loadCSV(java.lang.String filename,
                                                                            boolean isCustomCsv)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Takes a file named filename, which should be a csv, and returns an ArrayList of type CSVRecord. This can be queried using the get(index) method.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of the file to get data from.
        isCustomCsv - true if the file is a custom csv (i.e. not provided in the app)
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of CSVRecords of the each row of the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.

      • loadCSV

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.csv.CSVRecord> loadCSV(java.lang.String filename,
                                                                            int numberOfEntries)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Takes a file named filename, which should be a csv, and returns an ArrayList of type CSVRecord. This can be queried using the get(index) method. Only returns the first numberOfEntries entries (this may include header(s)).
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of the file to get data from.
        numberOfEntries - The number of entries to retrieve from the file.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of CSVRecords of the first numberOfEntries rows of the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there are not enough blocks in the file.

      • loadCSV

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.apache.commons.csv.CSVRecord> loadCSV(java.lang.String filename,
                                                                            int numberOfEntries,
                                                                            int blockNumber)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Takes a file named filename, which should be a csv, and returns an ArrayList of type CSVRecord. This can be queried using the get(index) method. Only returns the [blockNumber]th numberOfEntries entries (this may include header(s)).
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of the file to get data from.
        numberOfEntries - The number of entries to retrieve from the file.
        blockNumber - The block number (e.g. 0 = first lot of n entries, 1 = second lot of n entries)
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of CSVRecords of the [blockNumber]th numberOfEntries rows of the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there are not enough blocks in the file.

      • populateBikeTrips

        public static java.util.ArrayList<BikeTrip> populateBikeTrips()
                                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                                              CsvParserException
        Calls the load CSV method and populates an ArrayList with a set of BikeTrip objects from the default csv. This csv will be provided with the app.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of BikeTrips generated from the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        CsvParserException - if it can't find a single valid bike trip

      • populateBikeTrips

        public static java.util.ArrayList<BikeTrip> populateBikeTrips(java.lang.String filename)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                                              CsvParserException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        CsvParserException

      • populateBikeTrips

        public static void populateBikeTrips(java.lang.String filename,
                                     java.lang.String username,
                                     java.lang.String listName)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     CsvParserException
        Calls the load CSV method and populates an ArrayList with a set of BikeTrip objects from a given filename. This file should not be provided by the app (i.e. it should be provided by the user at runtime).
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file the data is to be loaded from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        CsvParserException - if it can't find a single valid bike trip

      • populateBikeTrips

        public static java.util.ArrayList<BikeTrip> populateBikeTrips(java.lang.String filename,
                                                              boolean isCustomCsv)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                                              CsvParserException
        Calls the load CSV method and populates an ArrayList with a set of BikeTrip objects from a given filename. If the isCustomCsv flag is set, it will act as if the csv is in the app's files.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file the data is to be loaded from.
        isCustomCsv - true if the file is a custom csv (i.e. not provided in the app)
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of BikeTrips generated from the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        CsvParserException - if it can't find a single valid bike trip

      • populateWifiHotspots

        public static java.util.ArrayList<WifiPoint> populateWifiHotspots()
                                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                  CsvParserException
        Calls the load CSV method and populates an ArrayList with a set of WifiPoint objects from the default csv. This csv will be provided with the app.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of WifiPoints generated from the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        CsvParserException - if it can't find a single valid wifi point

                                                                  boolean isCustomCsv)
                                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                  CsvParserException
        Calls the load CSV method and populates an ArrayList with a set of WifiPoint objects from a given filename. If the isCustomCsv flag is set, it will act as if the csv is in the app's files.

      • populateRetailers

        public static java.util.ArrayList<RetailerLocation> populateRetailers(java.lang.String filename)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                      CsvParserException
        Calls the load CSV method and populates an ArrayList with a set of RetailerLocation objects from a given filename. This file should not be provided by the app (i.e. it should be provided by the user at runtime).
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file the data is to be loaded from.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of RetailerLocation generated from the csv
        Throws:

        CsvParserException - if it can't find a single valid bike trip

      • populateRetailers

        public static java.util.ArrayList<RetailerLocation> populateRetailers(java.lang.String filename,
                                                                      boolean isCustomCsv)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                      CsvParserException
        Calls the load CSV method and populates an ArrayList with a set of RetailerLocation objects. If there are columns (9 and 10) for co-ordinates, these are loaded; otherwise, they are set to null. If the isCustomCsv flag is set, it will act as if the csv is in the app's files.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file the data is to be loaded from.
        isCustomCsv - true if the file is a custom csv (i.e. not provided in the app)
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of RetailerLocations generated from the csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
        CsvParserException - if it can't find a single valid retailer
